t: O*pn Lord,*s I call upon you; hasten to me! Give*ld ear to my voice when I call to you!
Let*ln my prayer be counted as incense before you, and*ld the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice!
Set*pn a guard, O Lord,*s over my mouth; keep*ld watch over the door of my lips!
Do*ln not let my heart incline to any evil, to*ld busy myself with wicked deeds in*ln company with men who work iniquity, and*ld let me not eat of their delicacies!
Let*pn a righteous man strike me— it is a kindness; let*ld him rebuke me— it is oil for my head; let*ld my head not refuse it. Yet*ln my prayer is continually against their evil deeds.
When*ln their judges are thrown over the cliff, then*ld they shall hear my words, for they are pleasant.
As*ln when one plows and breaks up the earth, so*ld shall our bones be scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
But*pn my eyes are toward you, O God,*s my Lord; in*ld you I seek refuge; leave me not defenseless!
Keep*ln me from the trap that they have laid for me and*ld from the snares of evildoers!
Let*ln the wicked fall into their own nets, while*ld I pass by safely.
